pageTitle: Impetus for Canon: Canon EOS 7D / 10D - 70D Talk Forum: Digital Photography Review
textBeforeTable: Flat view Next unread Next Previous First Parent Forum Complain Reply to thread   Reply with quote   I think the D200 is a great offering by Nikon for this reason: Canon should take serious notes on what are exactly "professional" features. It's been my biggest beef with Canon. They leave out small details in the interest of so-called product differentiation in their lower end models of DSLR's which quite practically need not be excluded...for example 1/3 stop ISO, spot metering, 2 sec delay timers, personalized settings, and 'novel' features like multiple exposures for starters. This stuff is implementable in software (except for perhaps the spot metering). And why not include some rubber gasketing
